meanings.definition: The quality or state of being contrary to what is considered normal or acceptable.
meanings.sent1: Her constant perversity in following rules made her stand out in the class.
meanings.sent2: His perversity in always choosing the opposite of what everyone else wanted caused frustration.
meanings.sent3: The perversity of the cat to sleep in the dog's bed always brings a smile to our faces.
meanings.sent4: The perversity of the weather to change suddenly kept everyone on their toes.
meanings.sent5: The perversity of the situation was so extreme that it became unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A deliberate desire to behave in an unreasonable or unacceptable way.
meanings.sent1: His perversity in refusing to listen to any advice led to his downfall.
meanings.sent2: The criminal's perversity in committing crimes for fun shocked the community.
meanings.sent3: The perversity of the child to eat dessert before dinner always amused the family.
meanings.sent4: Her perversity in always taking the most difficult path in life was like a puzzle to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The perversity of his actions left a lasting impression on all who witnessed them.
